item.title: Here’s what the first two trading days of January predict for stocks in 2025
item.description: The market can still deliver gifts even when the ‘Santa Claus rally’ fails.

item.title: Nasdaq Leads Indexes Higher
item.description: The S&P 500 and Nasdaq snapped five-day losing streaks, led higher by tech and chip stocks. The Dow Industrials also advanced.

item.title: U.S. Natural Gas Futures Sink on Weather Shift, Storage Miss

item.title: Forget Santa: Stock-market bulls look to ‘January barometer’ for clues on 2025
item.description: Santa Claus was a no-show on Wall Street, but stock-market bulls may be able to take their lump of coal in stride if January gets the year off to a po...

item.title: Stocks will struggle under Trump if this rate keeps going higher
item.description: U.S. debt concerns and higher Treasury yields may be stumbling blocks for stocks in 2025.

item.title: Why DraftKings is betting on a subscription service that gives members improved odds
item.description: Some consumers will have the ability to pay $20 a month for better odds on their parlays.

item.title: The WSJ Dollar Index Falls 0.2% To 102.99
item.description: The WSJ Dollar Index was down 0.2% to 102.99 — snapping a three-trading-day winning streak.
